column4: how do you successfully save all your settings for all your programs and still do a clean install every 6 months?
all the user settings are in their home directory. Other then  a few other files in /etc/ i dont have a lot of 'settings' for all my programs. to backup.
i save the samba config.. and thats about it... what else do ya keep?

sbackup.conf, updatedb.conf, and many others but I don't do a clean install every 6 months though so I can't remember what I all backup. I just backup everything with sbackup besides /proc/ and like 5 other directories.
i dont recall ever altering much in /etc/ other then the samba config.
